pages.text: Hydrogen is the first element on the periodic table, and has an atomic mass of 1. Hydrogen is a gas at normal room temperature and pressure. As it is a gas, you will not be able to hold this gas for long with your bare hands, so you will have to use a closed test tube or jar to store this gas.

pages.title: Obtainability
pages.text: There are multiple ways in which you can obtain hydrogen:$(li)Burning Fossil Fuels.$(br)This will release a small amount of hydrogen in which can be collected by something such as a Gas Extractor.
$(li)Bioreactor Photosynthesis(Biomass Gasification).$(br)This method requires you to put green algae into a bioreactor to release the product, that is hydrogen.
$(li)Electrolysis of Water$(br)This method will use an electrolizer to separate the hydrogen from the oxygen in water.
